cloud.jgo

Class j£

  • java.lang.Object
    • cloud.jgo.£
      • cloud.jgo.j£

  • public final class j£
extends £
    Version:
    1.0.1

    jGo.cloud/Boosted

    To be used as a Maven dependency


    Description :
    This class facilitates all the difficult tasks For example,In a code line, you take a screenshot, and do other general operations. the calls to the methods can be concatenated, so that different operations can be performed in the same programmatic instruction. jGo was born to facilitate the life of the java programmer, besides it provides different technologies like JjDom and JON for example. jGo also allows you to go to specific phases for specific programming +, for example if our application is a JFrame, we can find the general methods in the _S phase, object of the SwingUtils class Moreover jGo contains 3 phases for specific programming, for example if our application is a JFrame, we will find the general Swing methods in the £._S phase, static constant of type SwingUtils. However the WebUtils and AndroidUtils phases are still empty. The goal is to create a jar package comprising a wide range of general methods available to the user, so as to facilitate the life of the programmer, increase the performance of the program, and not less important, save a lot of time in terms of writing of the code. Moreover jGo provides very powerful objects, for example it is possible to create very powerful servers, for the moment servers whose protocol must be tcp, or an extension like http. Study the following server creation packages well:
    • cloud.jgo.net - contains all important interfaces, including the Server interface
    • cloud.jgo.net.tcp - contains all the tcp classes needed to implement a TCP server - TCPServer
    • cloud.jgo.net.http - contains all the http classes needed to implement a HTTP server - HTTPServer
    • cloud.jgo.net.http.jor - contains all the classes necessary for the implementation of a server with JOR technology - JORServer
    Or we can implement a terminal thanks to the objects contained in the package cloud.jgo.utils.command and cloud.jgo.utils.command.terminal. Then we have JjDom, a technology that allows us to create an HTML document and write jquery instructions in java. Furthermore we can of course write the css code necessary for our document. To use jGo, read the cookbook and consult the website at https://www.jgo.cloud/.
    Have fun !

    JGO is very powerful and it follows the jquery policy :

    (Write a little and get a lot)

    j - java

    G - General

    o - operations

    1 Example -This instruction opens the webcam, takes a snapshot and closes the webcam :

    1 | j£.openWebcam().capture("snapshot.png").closeWebcam();

    2 Example - This instruction sends a simple email without authentication :

    1 | j£.sendSimpleEmail("test@tim.it","staff@jgo.cloud","Test","Hello World","aruba","Email sent @");

    3 Example -This instruction prints in the console "hello world" and "hello world 2",
    also increases and decreases twice a counter:

    1 | £._O("Hello world").increment().decrement()
    2 |  ._O(    "Hello World 2").increment().decrement();

    4 Example - Opens the terminal, opens the notepad and emits an acoustic signal,
    also prints in the console "Hello world":

    1 | £.openTerminal().openNotepad().beep()._O("Hello World");

    5 Example -This instruction creates a file, a folder,
    and prints hello world using two alert windows:

    1 | £.createFile("hello world").md().alert("Hello").alert("World");

    6 Example (Iteration with jGo) - Simple use of the "each" method of jGo:

    1  | String[]arr = {"Alan","Peter","Lucas"};
    2  |    
    3  |    £.each(arr,    new £Func() {
    4  |        
    5  |        @Override
    6  |            public Object function(Object e) {
    7  |            
    8  |            System.out.println(    "Name:"+e);
    9  |            
    10 |                return true ;
    11 |        }
    12 |    });

    7 Example - Obviously more complex instructions can be combined
    Increment the counter twice, create a file, iterate the array using the "each" method, at the end it queries on google, decreases the value of the counter, and takes its value:

    1  | int counterValue = 
    2  |            
    3  |    £.increment().increment().createFile(    "test.json")
    4  |     .each(arr,    new £Func() {
    5  |         
    6  |        @Override
    7  |            public Object function(Object e) {
    8  |            
    9  |            £._O(    "Name :"+e);
    10 |            
    11 |                return true ;
    12 |        }
    13 |    }).executeGoogleQuery(    "jGo").decrement().value();

    In jGo there are 3 phases :

    • £._A - £.AndroidUtils - (cloud.jgo.£.AndroidUtils) -  for android programming
    • £._S - £.SwingUtils - (cloud.jgo.£.SwingUtils) -  for swing programming
    • £._W - £.WebUtils - (cloud.jgo.£.WebUtils) -  for web programming

    For example, let's see how to apply some swing methods :

    1 | £._S.hide(jframe,Effect.SLOW).show(jframe, Effect.SLOW);

    We can associate a click event to the button :

    1  | £._S.click(button,new £Func() {
    2  |        
    3  |        @Override
    4  |             public Object function(Object e) {
    5  |            
    6  |            
    7  |                return £.alert("Hello world");
    8  |            
    9  |        }
    10 |    });

    In any Phase we find ourselves, we can return to the access point using the "home ()" method :

    1 | £._S.applyEffect(Effect.CRAZY,jframe,jframe2,jframe3)
    2 |     .home().alert(    "Returned");

    Now let's move on to the jGo technologies :

    • JON - Java Object Notation - (cloud.jgo.io.jon)
    • JOR - Java Object Representation - (cloud.jgo.io.jon)
    • JjDom - Java jQuery Dom - (cloud.jgo.io.jon)

    Visit the jGo website : https://www.jgo.cloud/
    Author:
    Martire91
    See Also:
    £._A, £._S, £._W

      • sendSimpleEmail

        public static j£ sendSimpleEmail(java.lang.String recipient,
                                 java.lang.String sender,
                                 java.lang.String subject,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 java.lang.String smtpHost,
                                 int smtpPort,
                                 java.lang.String successLog)
        This method sends a simple email. There is no authentication for this method, and you can not set a contentType nor attach a document.
        Parameters:
        recipient - recipient email
        sender - sender email
        subject - email subject
        text - email text
        smtpHost - smtp host
        smtpPort - smtp port
        successLog - the log that is printed in case the email is sent correctly
        Returns:
        the jGo access point
